block.p: Dr. Yana Pikman and Dr. Vladimir Vinarsky are to be married this evening at Astoria Catering, a restaurant in Bensonhurst, Brooklyn. Rabbi Zev Goldfischer is to officiate.
The couple met at Harvard, from which each received a medical degree.
Dr. Yana Pikman and Dr. Vladimir Vinarsky are to be married this evening at Astoria Catering, a restaurant in Bensonhurst, Brooklyn. Rabbi Zev Goldfischer is to officiate.
Dr. Yana Pikman and Dr. Vladimir Vinarsky are to be married this evening at Astoria Catering, a restaurant in Bensonhurst, Brooklyn. Rabbi Zev Goldfischer is to officiate.
The couple met at Harvard, from which each received a medical degree.

The bride, 26, is keeping her name. She is to begin a residency in pediatrics this month at both the Children's Hospital in Boston and the Boston Medical Center. She graduated summa cum laude from Barnard. She is the daughter of Inna and Leonid Pikman of Fort Lee, N.J. Her father is an electrician with Local 3, an electrician's union in Manhattan. Her mother works in Little Falls, N.J., as a senior business analyst for Affiliated Computer Services, a Dallas-based company that provides clients with outsourcing solutions.

The bridegroom, 30, is an internal medicine resident at NewYork-Presbyterian/Columbia hospital in Manhattan. He graduated with high honors from the University of California, Berkeley. He is a son of Nataly and Boris Vinarsky of Foster City, Calif. His father is a computer systems engineer for Rambus, the computer chip designer in Los Altos, Calif.
